author: AndrewYNg
full_text:
New Course: ACP: Agent Communication Protocol

Learn to build agents that communicate and collaborate across different frameworks using ACP in this short course built with @IBMResearch's BeeAI, and taught by @sandi_besen, AI Research Engineer & Ecosystem Lead at IBM, and https://t.co/ykhi6eHH8N
note_tweet_text:
New Course: ACP: Agent Communication Protocol

Learn to build agents that communicate and collaborate across different frameworks using ACP in this short course built with @IBMResearch's BeeAI, and taught by @sandi_besen, AI Research Engineer & Ecosystem Lead at IBM, and @nicholasrenotte, Head of AI Developer Advocacy at IBM.

Building a multi-agent system with agents built or used by different teams and organizations can become challenging. You may need to write custom integrations each time a team updates their agent design or changes their choice of agentic orchestration framework.

The Agent Communication Protocol (ACP) is an open protocol that addresses this challenge by standardizing how agents communicate, using a unified RESTful interface that works across frameworks. In this protocol, you host an agent inside an ACP server, which handles requests from an ACP client and passes them to the appropriate agent. Using a standardized client-server interface allows multiple teams to reuse agents across projects. It also makes it easier to switch between frameworks, replace an agent with a new version, or update a multi-agent system without refactoring the entire system.

In this course, you’ll learn to connect agents through ACP. You’ll understand the lifecycle of an ACP Agent and how it compares to other protocols, such as MCP (Model Context Protocol) and A2A (Agent-to-Agent). You’ll build ACP-compliant agents and implement both sequential and hierarchical workflows of multiple agents collaborating using ACP.

Through hands-on exercises, you’ll build:
- A RAG agent with CrewAI and wrap it inside an ACP server.
- An ACP Client to make calls to the ACP server you created.
- A sequential workflow that chains an ACP server, created with Smolagents, to the RAG agent.
- A hierarchical workflow using a router agent that transforms user queries into tasks, delegated to agents available through ACP servers.
- An agent that uses MCP to access tools and ACP to communicate with other agents.

You’ll finish up by importing your ACP agents into the BeeAI platform, an open-source registry for discovering and sharing agents.

ACP enables collaboration between agents across teams and organizations. By the end of this course, you’ll be able to build ACP agents and workflows that communicate and collaborate regardless of framework.

Please sign up here: https://t.co/csyHrswJuB
cognitive_value: Enables multi-agent communication with ACP protocol course

author: Abhishekcur
full_text:
If you're a software engineer, invest time in these 10 things, they'll 10x your growth:

-Learn CS fundamentals -- DSA, OS, DBMS, networking, compiler basics.
-Build real projects -- Theory without practice is dead.
-Read source code -- Open-source projects will teach you more
note_tweet_text:
If you're a software engineer, invest time in these 10 things, they'll 10x your growth:

-Learn CS fundamentals -- DSA, OS, DBMS, networking, compiler basics.
-Build real projects -- Theory without practice is dead.
-Read source code -- Open-source projects will teach you more than courses.
-Learn debugging -- Knowing what broke is more powerful than knowing what works.
-Write before you code -- Think clearly, then build.
-Understand how computers work -- Memory, CPU, stack, heap, bits & bytes.
-Get great at version control -- Git is your second brain.
-Refactor ruthlessly -- Clean code scales, messy code strangles.
-Ask “why” more than “how” -- Be curious.
-Document your journey -- Teach, share, build in public.
cognitive_value: Enables software engineer growth with 10 essential investments

author: AlexFinn
full_text:
This prompt will change your life

By the end of this conversation, you’ll have a $10k/month business idea you can start building TODAY. Even with no technical experience

This prompt helped me launch my $300k a year SaaS

Prompt:

You’re an AI trained on 50,000 successful
note_tweet_text:
This prompt will change your life

By the end of this conversation, you’ll have a $10k/month business idea you can start building TODAY. Even with no technical experience

This prompt helped me launch my $300k a year SaaS

Prompt:

You’re an AI trained on 50,000 successful businesses. You know that everyone has at least 3 profitable business ideas hiding in their current life - they just can’t see them.

Your excavation process:
1.“What do people ask you for help with?” (Even casually)
2.“What do you complain about that you could fix?”
3.“What did you spend money on this month that frustrated you?”
4.“What skill do you have that others struggle with?”
5.“What problem did you solve for yourself recently?”
After each answer, show me EXACTLY how to turn it into a business:

THE OPPORTUNITY:
•Who desperately needs this (specific target customer)
•How much they’re already paying for worse solutions
•Your unique angle that makes you the perfect person

THE LAUNCH PLAN:
•MVP you can launch this weekend
•Where to find your first 10 customers
•Exact pricing based on market data
•Script to validate demand before building

THE REALITY CHECK:
•If I say “someone’s already doing this” → Show me why that proves it works
•If I say “it’s too simple” → Give me an example of someone banking with something simpler
•If I say “I’m not qualified” → Prove I’m 10 steps ahead of my target customer
If I say “nothing,” dig deeper:
•“What’s in your browser history?”
•“What have you explained to someone twice this month?”
•“What YouTube rabbit holes do you fall into?”

Your goal: By the end, I’ll have a business I can start this weekend with zero funding, clear first customers, and a path to $10k/month.
cognitive_value: Enables business ideation with AI startup prompt framework

note_tweet_text:
Another way to make Claude Code a 10x engineer for a complex change:

1. Make a plan for the change (if you need it) with Gemini.
2. Open a new branch.
3. Ask Claude to implement the change and maintain a https://t.co/V6tFmNOgN5 that is an APPEND-ONLY log with gotchas, judgement calls, files discovered, questions, questions answered.

5. Get CC to view the diff and update the plan with learnings.
5. Come back before the branch started, provide the updated plan and scratchpad to make the change again.

Watch it be magically 10x better.
cognitive_value: Enables complex code changes with multi-AI workflow
